page.title: 01Embo, North of Dornoch
page.content: This block is mainly sea, the Moray Firth giving onto the North Sea. The shore is sand, with deep water close in & a few rocks S of Embo, a small fishing village created in the 19th Century for people displaced in the clearances. The only fishing now is a few lobster boats but fisher folk still live here & a few are still Gaelic speakers. The harbour is a small pier S of the village. Today Embo is a tourist village with a big caravan/camp site & holiday complex with laundry, bars, dancehall, restaurant etc. There is a village shop & PO. North of Embo are sand dunes behind the beach, with flat farmland to the W. To the S lies part of the Royal Dornoch Golf Club's Championship Links Course, also affording fine coast walks with magnificent views.
